meanings.definition: A person who is regarded with contempt or irritation.
meanings.sent1: That blighter always ruins our plans.
meanings.sent2: The old blighter next door never returns our tools.
meanings.sent3: Can you believe that blighter ate the last cookie?
meanings.sent4: The blighter of laziness crept into his mind.
meanings.sent5: The blighter's smirk showed he knew he was causing trouble.

meanings.definition: A plant or animal that causes harm or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: The pesky blighter kept eating my garden plants.
meanings.sent2: Watch out for that blighter of a mosquito buzzing around.
meanings.sent3: The blighter squirrel stole all the birdseed again!
meanings.sent4: The blighter of a weed spread quickly through the garden.
meanings.sent5: The blighter raccoon knocked over the trash cans every night.

meanings.definition: Used as a mild expletive to express annoyance or frustration.
meanings.sent1: Oh blighter, I forgot my keys at home!
meanings.sent2: Well, blighter, the bus left without me again.
meanings.sent3: Blighter! I spilled my drink all over the table.
meanings.sent4: In the heat of the moment, he shouted, 'Blighter!'
meanings.sent5: Blast it all, that blighter of a pen ran out of ink.
